ratings.comment: Adams spends most of the lectures telling irrelevant stories. This class was a lot harder than I expected because the tests were hard. He doesn't use a computer for anything (grades, powerpoint, etc) which can be annoying. If you are going to take this class, try to find a different professor.

Professor Adams is a really funny guy, however his lectures were often pointless. I attended every one and really didn't learn much of anything. They all consisted of stories, most of which didn't pertain to the topics being covered. Tests are HARD. I don't know a single person who did good on them. Test questions are the SMALLEST details.

This class was not what I was expecting.  Lectures contain a lot of stories, and the tests are not easy.  The exams are all multiple choice and true false, and the grading system is over thought and overcomplicated.

Prof Adams is a great and hilarious guy. If you ever have him be sure to introduce yourself and ask him about singing for the class. His exams are fair. I got and A on the first exam and B on the second. Some questions are hard. If you go to class take good notes and are good at comprehending what you read. You will do fine in this class. Very Fun!

Bert has interesting stories but that's all his lectures are. I don't feel like I have learned much in this class and the exams are difficult. I don't know one person who has done well on them. Every little detail you see, hear or read is fair game for exams. Mult choice and T/F exams but you need to pick the answer thats "most correct"
I love this class! Bert is a great teacher, and he has a real life example for everything. He is hilarious and I love going to class just to hear him talk!

Prof Adams is a great professor. He is one of those adorable old men who can lecture and tell you stories for a whole day. The course material is pretty easy, and the exams are fair. Keep up with the notes though! Attendance to discussion mandatory.

Bert is that awesome and funny old guy in your family who really enjoys going on tangents about random stuff, except he does it in a professional setting! So hilarious.  Learn to take GOOD notes in his class, go to discussion, READ the books and packet, and study hard.  Easy enough B to A if you work hard.

Bert is darling. He's been teaching this class for a long time and knows a lot about his topic, and he tries to make it interesting. Tests are incredibly detailed. Any tiny detail in the readings is fair game for tests, but if you do the work, you'll get an A. Overall he's a funny and approachable professor, but I've heard the other prof is easier.

Prof Adams is one of the rare gems Madison has to offer. He has been here forever, and has tons of funny and fascinating stories to share as a result. Interesting material if you care about the topic. Exams are fair. Read and go to class- not too much to ask- and you'll get a good grade. Very sweet and compassionate guy if you go to office hours.

Not gonna lie, I took this class to get an easy A because everyone said it was a piece of cake.. It wasnt. Adams made the material way more difficult than it needed to be and his information was outdated. He doesn't use lecture notes at all and there are 3 different books to read. If you take this class, don't take it with him.

Prof Adams was amazing! He is so funny, and his lectures were always very interesting. His midterms were fair if you did the readings and attended class. I did about half of the readings and still got an AB or A in the class. He sings after his last lecture!

Bert attempts (and sometimes succeeds) to be funny. His lectures and books are VERY research based, meaning you will have to memorize many, many no named researchers and what they did. The exams are somewhat difficult. He mislead the entire class in the beginning that it would be an easy class, but don't be fooled. It's not.

He is an old, but funny man. He goes off on tangents and sometimes lectures are hard to follow because his outline is very brief. But overall it was a very interesting class. Exams were harder than expected, but if you do the reading and study, you'll be fine
The class is long and doesn't follow a clear path.  Bert is entertaining and really nice but the class is not always clear and he goes off on a lot of tangents and tells tons of random stories.

I thought the class overall was OK.  Dr. Adams is definitely the man, but the class was actually pretty challenging and my TA was horrible.  If you are good at memorizing stuff I would say go for it, but don't take this to get an easy A.

Class is harder than you might think.  Read EVERYTHING, anything you read could be on an exam.  Tests are pretty hard. TA's were semi-helpful...but not really. Adams lectures are "story-oriented"...he explains things through stories, sometimes hard to pay attention. But hes so cute, and sings the last lecture! 3 tests no final, mandatory discussion

this guy is hilarious and super funny. there is only multiple choice exams...so yeah.. despite getting a C in the class, it was still hilarious. The multiple choice are kinda hard unless you study (I didn't) I should prob nothave taken it for credit. But yeah, it's not hard to do well.

Whew.  I think I just got an A in this class.  The exam questions can be very tricky!  You MUST read every single thing very carefully.  Anything can show up on exams.  Interesting lectures...the reading can be very boring at times.  Overall a pretty easy class, and a nice man.

The first few weeks are not very fun.  The readings are pretty long and boring.  You really don't have to do them all, but if you want an A you probably should.  He is pretty funny and you never know what you're gonna get when you go to lectures.  Some test questions are confusing, but overall it's an interesting class and he's a great professor.
This man is by far my favorite professor.  So funny and energetic!!! Tells funny and interesting stories to make class go by faster.  I actually loved going to his class! He's such a sweet old man!!

Bert was a really funny professor at times, which made the long lecture go by much more quickly.  My only complaint is that many of the questions on his exams had very confusing wording.  The TA agreed that it was sometimes unclear exactly what he was asking.

This was by far my favorite class and Bert was by far my favorite teacher. He is funny, excited and interesting. The test clearly reflected the material and the reviews (which were lead by TA Deniz) were very very helpful. He is by far the most amazing professor I have ever had and this class was easy and interesting...I HIGHLY recommend it!!
listen to every detail, not hard to get a B or BC but it seemed like it was impossible to get an A

Are you kidding me?! unclear?! you must be a freshman. he gave out the easiest study guides. Half his exam came from post exams. he was incredibly clear. THE EASIEST class i've taken at UW (junior). Dont listen to the freshmen. take notes, go to lecture, and you're golden. he couldn't be any clearer. actually pretty interesting too. nice soc credit
i thought the class would be interesting but it was actually terrible. He is so unclear. TERRIBLE CLASS
pretty simple teacher. he tells you what you need to know and had awesome exams with the questions out ahead of time

Professor Adams is a really funny, caring man. His tests asked really silly questions so that even if you read everything, there was a chance you read over that one thing he asks. He sort of misled the class saying how easy it would be to get an "A" even though many people who worked hard did not get that grade.

Professor Adams is a really funny, caring man.  His tests asked really silly questions so that even if you read everything, there was a chance you read over that one thing he asks. He sort of misled the class saying how easy it would be to get an "A" even though many people who worked hard did not get that grade.
hes really funny. i didn't go to class after the first exam and I'm right on course for an A or an AB
tells a lot of stories...makes class fun
I love this old man! He is hilarious!! The material is interesting, and when it's not, he tells funny stories to make it more interesting. Going to lectures makes the exams really easy.

Hilarious. This is probably my favorite class for no other reason than I just like this guy's personality so much. He's really fun, full of little quips and interesting stories. The class isn't hard at all. I really enjoy it.

One of the better professors I've had. A lot of students say he's boring, but he's a fun old man and I enjoyed him. The 1st exam is the hardest and it just gets easier from there. (But I wouldn't even consider the 1st one hard.) Just pay attention in class, I barely took notes, and read a few nights before the exam and you'll do great. Easy A!
Great class and the professor tells many funny stories to keep the material interesting!
funny and nice

One of the easiest, most understandable classes I've ever taken. Read, study the night before & you're golden. Obviously a freshman class where lots of stupid questions are asked. Misleading in how college really is cuz its so easy. Hes lenient w/ the students unlike most profs. Im a jr & have never had a prof that lenient. A good prof, a great TA

Even though he wrote the packet that we were assigned to read from... he made more sense in lecture, so I would suggest attending class. Besides, he's pretty funny. Hearing him talk about parenting and sexuality is never boring. Only problem: I found myself unwillingly dozing off, esp. Mondays due to the comfy seats in IngrahamB10. Don't do that!
No Comments
No Comments
Great teacher. Very funny and interactive.

This is one of the worst classes I've taken.  The lectures are so boring that attendance is difficult.  The tests are shockingly difficult and detail-oriented.  Also, the content of the actual class is pretty inane.  I don't recommend this to anyone.
He's boring... and finds the most random things to test you on.
what we learned was easy and interesting information but the questions on tests were extremely ambiguous. you could study for hours and fail. a nice guy but very unfair and not understanding.
Lectures can get long and readings are boring, but tests aren't very tough if you study some.

lectures and the readings are really boring and the tests arent even that easy. you actually have to do all the readings cause he picks little things out of them. its definately not an easy A, you have to read a lot and study pretty well for the tests.
May get a little (lot) boring at times, but isn't that bad. Tests are straight forward.

I loved him to death. If you want to do well, then study and use your common sense. Take the test slow and you'll be fine. These people are complaining for no reason hello you're in college you can't just be given an A anymore. Im proof it can be done.
Prof. Adams was a great professor, and very interesting/funny.  Tests are fairly hard, and you must read the book.  Classes are recommended.
the lectures were interesting...lots of stories but not helpful at all. like they say you can study all you want but crossing your fingers and guessing is all you can do. HAVE FUN....NOT!!!!

You can read and study every word you're assigned but that doesn't mean you'll do well on the tests. Studying and a lot of guessing is what it turned into. I was told to take this class for an easy grade, not the case at all though. So don't think this is an easy A...the exact opposite!!

Although he may be a cute old man, that does not mean that he should still be teaching. If you like to hear stories about his experiences in Uganda, then go to lectures. Otherwise, stay away. I would not recommend this class to anyone. The tests were unfair. Maybe a discussion would help

He is a great professor.  The first two tests I slacked on and thus didn't get a good grade, but the third one I studied a ton for and did awesome.  You just have to apply yourself and study.  Be sure to read and it really helps if you take the practice/old tests from the internet.
prof loves to make jokes... its pretty entertaining.  tests moderately difficult- read the book
lectures amusing
He is a very funny and entertaining professor, it is sometimes hard to follow what he is saying though. You really need to take good notes and read to get a good grade in this class.
Funny guy, but I agree, the tests are misleading and all you can do is cross your fingers and guess.
lectures very entertaining. very funny, cute old man. tests much harder than expected because questions worded to trip you up. do the readings and take good notes in lecture.

I leave his lectures feeling good about myself. The only bad thing is that the only thing you are graded on are the exams so if you arent a good test-taker then this might not be the class for you. You also need to go to the lectures but they are entertaining. Great Prof!! One of my fav!!!
He is very entertaining in lecture, but I agree, his tests are awful.  Study like none other and just hope you can pull off a B.
Prof. Adams demonstrated nothing short of inspiration throughout my courses with him, both undergrad and grad.  I will never forget this man nor his singing.
it's crap, you dont' really know what dumb questions he'll throw on the exam. Plus, the questions are worded very badly and leave you confused. but yeah, if you like not getting an A, take this class

his tests are very unclear and misworded. he intentionally tries to trick his students into failing. i am unsatisfied with his tests though entertained by his lectures. i studied for a total of 24 hours for his exam and i received a %61 because his exam was very nebulous. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!!
If you talk to him during office hours he is extremely helpful. Take pass/fail!!
No Comments

Really cute old man & very entertaining, however he made everything seem way easier than the exams actually were.  You seriously need to read & study the book as well as attend all lectures to do well!
